artist: Artist: Hashiguchi Goyō (self-published); Carver: Koike Masazō; Printer: Somekawa Kanzō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: (Portrait of Chiyo, a Maiko of Gion, Kyoto). woman in green kimono with white birds and white, blue, yellow, pink and maroon butterflies, applying pigment to her lips with a small brush; woman holds a rectangular mirror in her PL hand; shiny peach ground; L2001.372.31 and L2001.372.38 are preliminary sketches for this print
inscription: 大正九年二月 {Taishō kunen nigatsu} (February 1920)
markings: red artist\'s seal: はしぐち五葉 {Hashiguchi Goyō}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica
text: Portrait of Chiyofuku 千代福, a maiko of Gion, Kyoto
title: Woman Holding a Lip Brush
